item.title: Command Giveitem [delta]
item.dc:creator: @usman555 usman555
item.description:
@usman555 wrote:

Ok, so I wanted to make a command called giveitem. This command will work like this:
::giveitem (Player name) (Item ID) (Item Amount)
The player you have entered in argument one will be give an item id you have entered in argument 2, and with the amount of argument 3. This is my command:

[code=java]
/**

  • Command giveitem. Gives a specific player an Item and an amount you have entered.

  • The problem seems to be fitting a String inside two integer codes.
    */
    if (command.startsWith(“giveitem”) && playerName.equalsIgnoreCase(“Usman”)) {
    String[] args = command.split(" ");

     try{ // try statement. Remember that there IS a catch for this.
 	String otherPName = command.substring(9); // enter valid player name after 9 characters
 	int otherPIndex = PlayerHandler.getPlayerID(otherPName);

 		if(args.length == 3){ // argument length must equal 3.
 			int ItemID = Integer.parseInt(args[1]);
 			int ItemAmount = Integer.parseInt(args[2]);

 				if(otherPIndex != 1) {
 					client p = (client) server.playerHandler.players[otherPIndex];

 						if(!IsInFightCave() && !p.IsInFightCave()){
 							p.addItem(ItemID, ItemAmount); // add item to "p" 
 							p.sM("You have recieved an item(s) from "+playerName+"!");
 							sM("You have given "+p.playerName+" and item(s)!");
 						}
 				}
 		}
 } catch (Exception e){ // catch phrase. Remember that there IS a try for this.
 	sM("Try entering a name you want to give an item to..");
 }

} // end code.[/code]

However, it doesn’t work. Can anyone identify any problems? Remember that this code gave no compiling errors.

Thanks,
Usman555

Read full topic
